siteMetadata.name: Sai Nikhil Thirandas
siteMetadata.title: Sai Nikhil | Graduate Student - Applied Mathematics | Aspiring Machine Learning Engineer
siteMetadata.description: I am a graduate student currently pursuing Masters in Applied Mathematics with a concentration in Machine Learning, from Northeastern University. I completed B. Tech (Hons.) from IIT Kharagpur. My primary strengths include Data Structure & Algorithm Implementation, System Designing. Besides this, I hold a strong background in Mathematics, specifically in areas of Calculus, Linear Algebra, Probability & Statistics. I'm looking for looking for fulltime opportunites in the Machine Learning space.
siteMetadata.about: I'm pursuing a master's degree in Applied Mathematics at Northeastern University - College of Science with a concentration in Machine Learning and Statistics.
siteMetadata.author: @saint1729

projects.name: Matrix Factorization for User Rating Predictions
projects.description: Derived update rules and implemented Weighted Alternating Least Squares for predicting missing user ratings of MovieLens data. Improved MSE by 62 % compared to baseline (mean predicting) model.

projects.name: Data Modeling - Markov Chain
projects.description: Performed Time Series Analysis of average runs of opening batters in baseball from 1871 – 2015 with a Markov Chain. Calculated autocorrelation between original time series and a simulated time series. Performed GoF test at 5 % significance level to determine valid states of Markov Chain in a two-step transition matrix.

projects.name: FaceNet - Face Recognition
projects.description: Encoded face image into 128-dimension feature vector (one-shot learning) using FaceNet. Implemented Triplet Loss function to compare Anchor, Positive, and Negative images in training data. Performed face verification and face recognition using the above encodings.

projects.name: Debiasing Word Vectors
projects.description: Used 50-dimensional GloVe vectors to represent words. Performed Word Analogy task. Implemented equalization algorithm presented in Boliukbasi et al., 2016 to remove gender bias.
